extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite  Second year standing or above

basic.description: An investigation of the impact of war on art and architecture, as well as human attempts to preserve cultural heritage. A chronological or thematic approach may be taken, with focus placed on one or more case studies, such as: the Sacks of Rome, the Napoleonic wars, Nazi looting, the Cultural Revolution in China, Afghanistan under Taliban rule.
basic.subject: ARTH
basic.title: Culture and Conflict
